info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 15 at 2:27AM MST by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong cold front will be moving through western Mesa and southwestern Garfield Counties through 300 AM MST... At 224 AM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong cold front with embedded thunderstorms along a line extending from 37 miles south of Rangely to 9 miles northwest of Fruita to 17 miles east of Castle Valley. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 55 mph will be possible ahead of and with the passage of the front. Rain will fall with the frontal passage and as colder air filters in a switch to snow is possible. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Grand Junction, Fruita, Palisade, Loma, Cameo, Fruitvale, Gateway, Clifton, Orchard Mesa, Whitewater, Glade Park and Redlands. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 13 and 59. U.S. Highway 50 in Colorado between mile markers 32 and 49. Colorado 65 between mile markers 56 and 61. Colorado 139 between mile markers 1 and 38. Colorado 141 between mile markers 104 and 162. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
